result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy A. Wettstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**3 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 20CF642, 21CF916, 21CF1263.

No contact with T.L. unless she and the agent approve.

records.addlTxt: Dated 06/13/2022, Letter from Defendant regarding in-person or virtual appearances.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.
**SEE PLEA HEARING DOCKET DATED 6/17/22**

Cases called at 11:32 AM: 20CF642, 21CF916, 21CF1263, 22CF370. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing and in person.
Defendant Troy A. Wettstein appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Troy A. Wettstein.  
District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to personal appearance. Agreement has been reached. 
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing in 21CF916, 21CF1263 and 22CF370.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
20CF642: Defendant pleads No Contest to an Amended Count 1: Possession With Intent to Deliver THC (>200-1000g);2nd or Subsequent Offense (Without Repeater) and an Amended Count 3: Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct. Priors acknowledged. 
21CF916: Defendant pleads No Contest to an Amended Count 1: Misdemeanor Bail Jumping.
21CF1263: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping.
22CF370: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine.
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 3 Years of Probation (On the Felonies only) with the following conditions:
90 Days of Jail with Huber (Count 1 of 20CF642) stayed pending further order of the Court.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with D.N. (2-5-10) or A.N. (10-26-08) unless their mother and the agent approve.
No contact with T.L. unless she and the agent approve. No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Forfeit seized $2,042.00 to WCDTF (from case 20CF642).Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Court costs/surcharges including one warrant fee in 20CF642.
Misdemeanor Charges: (20CF642 Count 3 and 21CF916 Count 1): Defendant is sentenced to Court Costs/surcharges including one warrant fee in 21CF916, DNA sample/surcharge.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.  Contraband ordered returned upon completion of appellate period.
Defendant is granted 3 days of sentence credit in 22CF370 and 20CF642.
Same as Complaint.
for transport for a hearing on 06/17/2022 at 11:30 a.m.

(11:30 AM cases 20CF642, 21CF916, 21CF1263, 22CF370 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Troy A. Wettstein appeared by video, in custody in the Chippewa County Jail. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Troy A. Wettstein. 
Attorney Thorson advises wasn't aware the defendant was in the Chippewa Jail, thought he was in the Eau Claire Jail and was anticipating completing paperwork.
Attorney Thorson advises cases are close to a joint resolution.
Defendant is requesting a no contact be addressed.
Attorney Thorson advises can make a motion for bond modification.
State objects to any bond modification.
Court orders the motion for bond modification is denied.
Parties advise will have the defendant transported here for next hearing.

(3:35 PM cases 20CF642, 21CF916, 21CF1263, 22CF370 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Troy A. Wettstein appeared by video, in custody in the Chippewa County Jail. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Troy A. Wettstein.
Attorney Thorson advises the defendant has court tomorrow in Chippewa County for two cases.
Attorney Thorson advises there has been a suggestion from the State for resolution of all cases and Attorney Thorson will have a conversation with the defendant regarding preliminary hearings or waivers.
Court notes if there is no agreement by the next court date, case 20CF642 will need to be scheduled for trial.
State notes the defendant has previously waived right to a jury trial in 20CF642 so would be scheduling a Court Trial.
Status Conference in 20CF642 and Hearing in 21CF916, 21CF1263, 22CF370 scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 3 pm, defendant may appear via Zoom.
